document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

564A208009BA4773BEF2EDDA518E4888.description:
Recognize when two- and three-dimensional figures are similar and solve problems, including
those in context, involving attributes of similar geometric figures.

696CDA0326D14586982259C4132BE0A8.description: Compare ratios between side lengths, perimeters, areas, and volumes of similar figures.

6F73F83EAF2D443EBED5423F78818BB6.description:
Solve problems, including those in context, involving changing the dimensions or derived
measures of a three-dimensional figure.

BD0CCE2FC7594E168C38320A63BD492D.description:
Describe how changes in surface area and/or volume of a figure affect the measures of one or
more dimensions of the figure.

52CFF1BAC0DD404895AB0FC5E1B350F0.description:
Describe how changes in one or more dimensions of a figure affect other derived measures
(perimeter, area, total surface area, and volume) of the figure.

1F4BB59B31644E2885FF994D968B4219.description:
The student will determine the effect of changing one or more dimensions of a threedimensional geometric figure and describe the relationship between the original and
changed figure.

E2DFB6B216F14A15A64B0733A7B7CD90.description:
Determine unknown measurements of three-dimensional figures using information such as
length of a side, area of a face, or volume.

4602718F3950413A911E6B3B8DDB1D54.description:
Solve multistep problems, including those in context, involving volume of three-dimensional
figures, as well as composite three-dimensional figures.

607FDE81F9C7493CA9E8BCC83EE2CDFB.description: Create models and solve problems, including those in context, involving surface area of threedimensional figures, as well as composite three-dimensional figures.

B88685C9391D4CF8AA5BD43567C6F53F.description: Identify the shape of a two-dimensional cross section of a three-dimensional figure.

D03CFEE8614D4B6F89B792A34A88EDF6.description:
The student will create models and solve problems, including those in context,
involving surface area and volume of rectangular and triangular prisms, cylinders,
cones, pyramids, and spheres.

52C8031772E84E94B720A8AB704EEC38.description: coordinates of the endpoints of a diameter.

3F74C1BC1C844D39B192FBD418D52F3C.description: coordinates of the center and the length of the radius or diameter; and

C84B0073D3FD471B8BFF3E3BDD726760.description: coordinates of the center and a point on the circle;

7C6A425CA1AB4D47A961914AE6628C5D.description: a graph of a circle with a center with coordinates that are integers;

2A406304875849AB93B91E01E96595B8.description: Determine the equation of a circle given:

3B818DF8F9AC4C2397D14977455269C4.description:
given the coordinates of the center and length of the radius of a circle, identify the
coordinates of a point(s) on the circle.

C50D236F55FC4C20BBD35AB66F2D0E86.description:
given the coordinates of the center and the coordinates of a point on the circle, determine
the length of the radius or diameter of the circle; and

FE51E69F1DDF4A238BC5AF209FF60DBF.description:
given the coordinates of the endpoints of the diameter of a circle, determine the length of
the radius or diameter of the circle.

9F12E4922AB248B89DEA5E4AEF44ABF4.description:
given a graph or the equation of a circle in standard form, identify the length of the radius
or diameter of the circle.

9E8F0E3E1422466FB5ADB2EF921059E1.description:
given the coordinates of the endpoints of a diameter of a circle, determine the coordinates
of the center of the circle.

06AC690505A749258E3723C77767D4DC.description:
given a graph or the equation of a circle in standard form, identify the coordinates of the
center of the circle;

04B0230D05314EA79C66643EA13780E1.description: Solve problems in the coordinate plane involving equations of circles:

3CFB0D909AA74200935EF5B8141F006A.description: Derive the equation of a circle of given the center and radius using the Pythagorean Theorem.

BC9E49E7FA2B4333A5828B22E03A5496.description: The student will solve problems in the coordinate plane involving equations of circles.

5F9E78D090DD48D687B3F9C6AFFD6701.description:
Apply arc length or sector area to solve for an unknown measurement of the circle including
the radius, diameter, arc measure, central angle, arc length, or sector area.

49150488C5E74769AA7380679939AA67.description: Calculate the area of a sector of a circle.

155BBDBA640F406587247FB2AD31DCD2.description: Calculate the length of an arc of a circle.

DC61E5D42E154E9FAB96FBEC8EFAB3C0.description: Solve for arc measures and angles in a circle involving inscribed angles.

E201F0594F6046AF9F5CD1B574C79DBA.description: Solve for arc measures and angles in a circle formed by central angles.

41D6F6BE84C342938B7F21F578F3467C.description:
Determine the proportional relationship between the arc length or area of a sector and other
parts of a circle.

C80833A5CB4F498FB8EF7C190018C169.description:
The student will solve problems, including those in context, by applying properties of
circles.

0CD3879F121444A3B1265E026ECBE1E6.description:
Justify the relationship between the measure of each interior and exterior angle of a regular
polygon and solve problems involving the measures of the angles.

A18B1105623B46EDA8C6510A8C019325.description:
Justify the relationship between the sum of the measures of the interior and exterior angles of
a convex polygon and solve problems involving the sum of the measures of the angles.

69533E7EB889452D8AB00BA4C776C2D2.description:
Solve problems involving the number of sides of a regular polygon given the measures of the
interior and exterior angles of the polygon.

B20C6C19F80A431195CD20E2CFFB9AAF.description:
The student will verify relationships and solve problems involving the number of sides
and measures of angles of convex polygons.

6DD7FD5DDFD5461796CD3575A265F7C7.description:
Use congruent segment, congruent angle, angle bisector, perpendicular line, and/or parallel
line constructions to verify properties of quadrilaterals.

5057992AA5E84C65BEC87F7F4219E2B6.description: Prove and justify theorems and properties of quadrilaterals using deductive reasoning.

3330E554E7F846A4BB6B42D307FA5E4C.description:
Prove and justify that quadrilaterals have specific properties, using coordinate and algebraic
methods, such as the slope formula, the distance formula, and the midpoint formula.

7242F9607ECB42FDB2F7523E0A5273B4.description:
Solve problems, using the properties specific to parallelograms, rectangles, rhombi, squares,
isosceles trapezoids, and trapezoids.

6E1E209C0ADC44DB9DDC5D31693E9E9E.description:
The student will prove and justify theorems and properties of quadrilaterals, and
verify and use properties of quadrilaterals to solve problems, including the
relationships between the sides, angles, and diagonals

0932050EAD54499386C63B3132F84B89.description:
Solve problems, including those in context, involving right triangles using the Pythagorean
Theorem and its converse, including recognizing Pythagorean Triples.

EE06736873F7470EBFB15383BA6B6CC1.description:
Solve for missing lengths in geometric figures, using properties of 30°-60°-90° triangles,
where rationalizing denominators may be necessary.

F787559F74CE4AD2BE169533F5A4330E.description:
Solve for missing lengths in geometric figures, using properties of 45°-45°-90° triangles,
where rationalizing denominators may be necessary.

71EC7B1441B74DDEB7772A617E384C73.description: Solve problems using the properties of special right triangles.

AEEEE32030C14310A906EAFDCE6774C9.description:
Model and solve problems, including those in context, involving right triangle trigonometry
(sine, cosine, and tangent ratios).

BEBD885E60234508A8C512A084FBE428.description: Find and verify trigonometric ratios using right triangles.

8768B1482661466686514A7A4C04ACAF.description: Determine whether a triangle formed with three given lengths is a right triangle.

A935B6112DF4453AA635F06D8330248F.description:
The student will model and solve problems, including those in context, involving
trigonometry in right triangles and applications of the Pythagorean Theorem.

CE7CA169440440FBB0F1B68E72D77910.description: Solve problems, including those in context involving attributes of similar triangles.

D7B220B1DE8642A8A79B634EFA8727D0.description:
Describe a sequence of transformations that can be used to verify similarity of triangles
located in the same plane.

6B6279ADFC184DB5973A200E7F0981D9.description:
Use coordinate methods, such as the slope formula and the distance formula, to prove two
triangles are similar.

926089525D6C412597E48144A84F0E0A.description: Use algebraic methods to prove that triangles are similar.

1E0DCD64E4094D1DA705F9F807A03CBF.description:
Use definitions, postulates, and theorems (including Side-Angle-Side (SAS); Side-Side-Side
(SSS); and Angle-Angle (AA)) to prove and justify that triangles are similar.

02916DCBAEA24C71A120484F9349A74E.description:
The student will, given information in the form of a figure or statement, prove and
justify two triangles are similar using direct and indirect proofs, and solve problems,
including those in context, involving measured attributes of similar triangles.

AB4512F10C0F4C5E996B7245B0D03DF4.description:
Given a triangle, use congruent segment, congruent angle, and/or perpendicular line
constructions to create a congruent triangle (SSS, SAS, ASA, AAS, and HL).

3726E2144E5341AC857A021B434CC8F2.description:
Use coordinate methods, such as the slope formula and the distance formula, to prove two
triangles are congruent.

85F5B4CA9B12412EAB99E8E8802ED0BE.description: Use algebraic methods to prove that two triangles are congruent.

3D6AF17444824083B77BD3FCD8EE1F71.description:
Use definitions, postulates, and theorems (including Side-Side-Side (SSS); Side-Angle-Side
(SAS); Angle-Side-Angle (ASA); Angle-Angle-Side (AAS); and Hypotenuse-Leg (HL)) to
prove and justify two triangles are congruent.

A302CB5647B94013B06804B1B568BA0B.description:
The student will, given information in the form of a figure or statement, prove and
justify two triangles are congruent using direct and indirect proofs, and solve
problems involving measured attributes of congruent triangles.

9C03B83D0C7B4BB889E3BC4159D666D0.description: Solve for interior and exterior angles of a triangle, when given two angles.

D841281D4882448F87324C5437779EB5.description:
Order the angles of a triangle by their measures when given information about the lengths of
the sides.

2C661E0219DD4931B9F9996C49EA1149.description:
Order the sides of a triangle by their lengths when given information about the measures of
the angles.

79458C5CE17447D5986CFEC7F73F725B.description:
Given the lengths of two sides of a triangle, determine the range in which the length of the
third side must lie.

0D9583A282204AFA9649859520CB04C5.description: Given the lengths of three segments, determine whether a triangle could be formed.

80DB37895A654F0D8C7A781C6C62DE6C.description:
The student will determine the relationships between the measures of angles and
lengths of sides in triangles, including problems in context.

5CB95E40B19A44DF84EFC4F8E9B08154.description: dilations, from a fixed point on a coordinate grid.

6853C77357C444D5B790487A60470AB3.description:
clockwise or counterclockwise rotations of 90°, 180°, 270°, or 360° on a coordinate grid
where the center of rotation is limited to the origin; and

16BD1462D3C447099E929B68ACFB9AC6.description: reflections over any horizontal or vertical line or the lines y = x or y = -x;

2A0A1FEC4D6D4EA096ABD44BDC322C8B.description:
Given an image or preimage, identify the transformation or combination of transformations
that has/have occurred. Transformations include:

C5DF7C284340494B96494EE20961286E.description:
Determine whether a figure has point symmetry, line symmetry, both, or neither, including
figures in context.

2B9C83CE18C14FCC8566E8EC6FE4F7AD.description: Locate, count, and draw lines of symmetry given a figure, including figures in context.

35B0E09A645645CC870B848E73210881.description:
The student will solve problems, including contextual problems, involving symmetry
and transformation.

5768EB27B0084585851C1B117A408CF7.description:
Solve problems by using the relationships between pairs of angles formed by the intersection
of two parallel lines and a transversal.

7497D0BE8A6B45CE8ECB0AE6D90D2F30.description:
Prove two or more lines are parallel given angle measurements expressed numerically or
algebraically.

05E708A25B34439384788020DF96D1F2.description:
Prove and justify angle pair relationships formed by two parallel lines and a transversal,
including:

601CA9D229044EB489330DCA249F0C80.description:
The student will analyze, prove, and justify the relationships of parallel lines cut by a
transversal.

A6ECD360B6D642E1B190BD0D1AD75309.description: Interpret Venn diagrams, including those representing contextual situations.

2EDFC0490F2A420385A948A9AEFFF5B0.description:
Use Venn diagrams to represent set relationships, including union, intersection, subset, and
negation.

747A05A1A22242ECAA43FFCC3457A9E5.description:
Identify and determine the validity of the converse, inverse, and contrapositive of a
conditional statement, and recognize the connection between a biconditional statement and a
true conditional statement with a true converse, including statements representing geometric
relationships.

C2C2A49EE40E475AAC431C7D28223163.description:
Translate propositional statements and compound statements into symbolic form, including
negations (~𝑝, read “not p”), conjunctions (p ∧ 𝑞, read “p and q”), disjunctions (p ∨ 𝑞, read
“p or q”), conditionals (p → q, read “if p then q”), and biconditionals (p ↔ q, read “p if and
only if q”), including statements representing geometric relationships.

D3E2161099284A5293BCFA468FCF6833.description:
The student will translate logic statements, identify conditional statements, and use
and interpret Venn diagrams.
